description: Dive into "Shopping Adventures in Petaling Jaya" — a handpicked list of places with quick notes, links, and essentials for fast trip planning and discovery.
title: Shopping Adventures in Petaling Jaya

places.generalDescription: Pavilion Kuala Lumpur is a massive, high-end shopping destination located in the heart of the trendy Bukit Bintang district. This sprawling 1.37 million square feet complex houses luxury and mainstream retailers as well as numerous global dining options. The mall, which opened in September 2007, is a prominent feature of the city center and includes a retail mall, an office block, and two residential towers. It's surrounded by upscale hotels and is known for its vibrant atmosphere.

sources.snippet: The  grand dame of luxury shopping in the heart of Kuala Lumpur has to be Pavilion Kuala Lumpur. Located along the Bukit Bintang main vein, this expansive palatial paradise consecrated to luxury retail opened its doors to the public in 2007 and has become an undisputed landmark in the city ever since. Sporting a grand foyer that invites all to explore within, you’ll find physical retail outlets for most major high fashion names here, from Hermes, to Chopard and Henry Jacques.
sources.shortName: Best shopping malls in Kuala Lumpur: How to get there

places.name: Pavilion Kuala Lumpur

reviews.text: My wife and I are currently visiting KL and our hotel is just next to this huge and very popular mall in Bukit Bintang. We last visited this mall in 2017 and we are happy to see that it is still going strong with retail and food and beverage shops aplenty - from the expensive ones to the affordable ones, and from the global branded ones to the local branded ones to the independent ones. And we are impressed that it also houses 2 big food courts therein - Food Republic and Food Place. And there is even a Tokyo Street for many many things Japanese. This mall is certainly THE place to shop and dine at in KL.

Pavilion Kuala Lumpur is like the Times Square of KL but in a more upscale and modern way. It's bustling, lively and full of energy with tons of shopping options from luxury brands to popular international chains.

The mall's layout is easy to navigate the food choices are fantastic and the overall vibe feels very cosmopolitan and vibrant. It's definitely one of the top places to visit if you want a premium shopping and dining experience in Kuala Lumpur.

Perfect spot for both locals and tourists looking for the latest trends and good food!

Pavilion Mall in Kuala Lumpur is an absolute delight for shoppers and tourists! From high-end international brands to trendy local shops, it has everything under one roof. The mall is beautifully designed, very clean, and gives a luxurious feel. The food court and restaurants offer a wide variety of delicious options from all around the world. It's centrally located in Bukit Bintang and perfect for spending a full day - shopping, dining, and even just relaxing. The festive decorations and events are always amazing too. Highly recommended for anyone visiting KL!

places.address: 168, Bukit Bintang Rd, Bukit Bintang, 55100 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Pavilion KL is a must-visit shopping destination in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia. Spanning 1.7 million square feet, it offers six precincts housing major fashion labels, an atrium, food court, entertainment and sports area, beauty parlors, and convenience stores. Even for non-shoppers, the fancy interior makes it worth a quick visit. The mall also features a Tesla supercharger in its B1 carpark for electric vehicle owners.

sources.snippet: Another famous shopping mall in Kuala Lumpur, Pavilion KL is one of the largest shopping destination, covering a whopping 1.37 million sq. ft. that opened in 2007, while accommodating 450+ retail stores. Pavilion KL (image courtesy: lonelyplanet.com)
sources.shortName: 10 Best Shopping Malls in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.name: Pavilion Kuala Lumpur

And we are impressed that it also houses 2 big food courts therein - Food Republic and Food Place. And there is even a Tokyo Street for many many things Japanese. This mall is certainly THE place to shop and dine at in KL.

The mall is beautifully designed, very clean, and gives a luxurious feel. The food court and restaurants offer a wide variety of delicious options from all around the world. places.generalDescription: Mid Valley Megamall is a shopper's paradise that offers a diverse range of retail experiences. It houses over 400 retailers in twelve categories, including fashion, lifestyle, home furnishings, cosmetics, and healthcare essentials. This mall is not just for shopping; it also features dining options and entertainment facilities like an 18-screen cinema. Located between the city center and Klang Valley, it is part of a large urban development project that includes office blocks and hotels.

sources.snippet: Mid Valley Megamall is home to a dazzling array of fashion and lifestyle innovations, home furnishings, cosmetics, healthcare essentials, wining, dining, and all things entertainment. There’s plenty to keep devoted shoppers happy with 1.7 million square feet of nett lettable space and over 400 retailers in twelve categories. AEON, Metrojaya, and Golden Screen Cinemas are among the 430 speciality stores, which include high fashion international and local brands.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Best Shopping Malls for Hangouts in Klang Valley 2024

sources.snippet: Another shopping mall in KL that makes shopping in Malaysia a fun-filled affair is the Mid Valley Megamall. Nestled halfway between the city center and Klang Valley, the mall is part of one of the largest urban development projects in the country and features an office block, 30 signature offices, and 3 hotels alongside the shopping mall. With a total of 430 stores spread across five floors and an 18-screen Golden Screen Cinema, this is a mall that has it all.
sources.shortName: Top 8 Malls In Kuala Lumpur Every Shopper Should Visit

sources.snippet: The Mid Valley Megamall is a humongous shopping complex located in the Mid Valley City, halfway between Petaling Jaya and Kuala Lumpur. The Mid Valley Megamall has about 430 local and international stores that span across 5 floors. While the mall is a great destination for shopaholics, it also houses a cinema hall, bowling alley and bookstore thereby keeping visitors entertained.
sources.shortName: 20 Malls in Malaysia (2024)

sources.snippet: Mid Valley MegaMall boasts over 430 shops, including a large Factory Outlet Store offering a good range of low-priced branded clothing. This largest shopping mall has four department stores: Aeon, Isetan, Robinson and Metrojaya. With a total floor area of 4,500,000 sq.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Popular Largest Shopping Malls in Malaysia

sources.snippet: The Mid Valley Megamall is one of the most buzzing Kuala Lumpur malls. The huge shopping complex lies just outside Bangsar and is a regular jaunt for locals coming from the City Center and Klang Valley alike. Mid Valley Megamall (image courtesy: malaymail.com)
sources.shortName: 10 Best Shopping Malls in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
10 Best Shopping Malls in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.name: Mid Valley Megamall

reviews.text:
My family finds Mid Valley Megamall a convenient spot for our diverse needs. We appreciate the wide array of shops, catering to both our teenager's fashion interests and my spouse's electronics hunt. The food options are plentiful, making it easy to find something everyone likes for lunch. While it can get crowded, especially on weekends, the ample parking helps.

What other Google reviews says:
for Mid Valley Megamall frequently mention its vast size and extensive selection of retail stores, covering fashion, electronics, and more. The diverse food and beverage options are often highlighted as a major draw. Many reviewers comment on its crowded nature, particularly during peak hours, but also appreciate the good accessibility and parking facilities. Some reviews also note the presence of a cinema and other entertainment options.

Its a big shopping centre located at Mid valley.  Many food options and famous brands retail shops. There Cinema, Bowling Alley. There also Aeon shopping within. Easy connection from LRT/KTM toward the mall. Good to spend some good hours inside the mall.

I'm really enjoyed my shopping at Midvalley this round. Usually I'm didn't shop much here. But this August month really spent on here. Usually go over here just for money changer and eat food.. But this round I spent more then before.

places.address: Lingkaran Syed Putra, Mid Valley City, 59200 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: 1 Utama Shopping Centre, situated in Bandar Utama Township, Malaysia, is a colossal mall that boasts over 700 shops spread across 5 million square feet and 6 expansive retail levels. As the seventh-largest mall globally, it offers an opulent shopping experience with a wide array of high-end international chains, department stores, and dining options. Additionally, visitors can enjoy entertainment facilities such as cinemas and a rooftop garden.

sources.snippet: 1 Utama Shopping Centre is proud to be one of the world’s largest malls. 1 Utama, with its tagline “It’s all in one,” this multi-award-winning regional mall 1 Utama, located in the MSC Malaysia Cybercentre township Bandar Utama, Malaysia, has over 750 shops spread across 5.59 million sq ft and seven extensive retail levels. Other notable sports and entertainment venues in 1 Utama include Asia’s largest indoor rock climbing gym Camp5, PADI 5-star diving centre Sealantis, rooftop futsal Padang, Celebrity Fitness lifestyle gym, and Wangsa Bowl.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Best Shopping Malls for Hangouts in Klang Valley 2024

sources.snippet: Spread across 5 million square feet of space and six retail levels, and touted as one of the top 10 largest in the world, 1 Utama Shopping Center has a dizzying number of options if you’re looking for something to do with the whole family. Outdoor enthusiasts can head to Asia’s largest indoor rock climbing gym, Camp5 and climb away, or try their hand at baseball and softball at It’s A Hit Batting Cage. For futsal fans, there are five futsal courts on the upper roof known as Padang@1U.
sources.shortName: Best Malls For Families In Kuala Lumpur

sources.snippet: As the world’s 6th largest mall, 1 Utama Shopping Centre is a premier lifestyle mall with something for everyone and is connected to One World Hotel. This award-winning mall also includes South East Asia’s largest rooftop garden that has become a popular tourist attraction. Spanning 5 million square feet with 6 retail levels, 1 Utama has a mix of over 700 retail shops, 2 different cinemas – GSC and TGV under one roof, arcades and karaoke centre.
sources.shortName: Discover 1 Utama Shopping Centre

sources.snippet: This shopping center is one of the most popular spots of Klang Valley and is considered as one of the best malls of the city. The mall is located at about a distance of 30 minutes from the KL city and has a lot to offer to the shoppers. There are more than 650 stores within the mall itself, which also include a number of entertainment outlets as well as a variety of restaurants.
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls in Petaling Jaya

sources.snippet: Located in Bandar Utama, 1 Utama Shopping Mall is the best place where you can enjoy some shopping on your vacation. Being one of the top malls in Kulala Lumpur, 1 Utama features the best service and facilities for your comfort. Not only in Kulala Lumpur but the mall is also listed as the largest shopping center in Malaysia.
sources.shortName: Top 8 Malls In Kuala Lumpur Every Shopper Should Visit

sources.snippet: Bandar Utama, Selangor, Malaysia’s 1 Utama, is a 5,590,000 square foot mall with 713 shops. It is Malaysia’s biggest and the world’s seventh-largest retail mall. The “Old Wing” of the mall, which opened in September 1995, was the initial phase of the mall.
sources.shortName: 10 PETALING JAYA SHOPPING MALL

sources.snippet: Since you are visiting Malaysia, you want to explore Malaysia’s largest shopping center. Besides that, it is also the seventh-largest shopping mall in the world. Established in 1995, the mall has more than 700 stores inside.
sources.shortName: 5 Top Shopping Malls In Kl For A Unique Retail Therapy

sources.snippet: 1 Utama Mall is one of the largest shopping malls in Malaysia and ranks among the top 10 world’s largest malls. It spans over 5.59 million sq. ft. with over 700 shops across 7 retail levels.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Popular Largest Shopping Malls in Malaysia

places.name: 1 Utama Shopping Centre

reviews.text:
This mega mall was truly an eye-opener for me. After walking around for over six hours, I still only managed to cover about 80% of its massive 5.5 million square feet. It's packed with shops, restaurants, cafés, supermarkets - you name it.

The layout can be a little overwhelming, especially if it is your first or second visit, so taking your time to explore both the old sections and the newly revamped wings is key. If you are in Petaling Jaya, it's definitely a spot worth checking out.

Went to next gen theme park and enjoyed the mall as well. It has almost all great brands, a superstore and an excellent food court
Pros:
1- next gen theme park for kids.
2- arcade games for kids
3- grocery store with great prices.
4- excellent food area with kfc, burger king, McDonald's, Texas chicken , Dunkin donut, Starbucks etc..
5- enjoyed shopping as well
6- not very crowded.

I had a wonderful visit to 1 Utama Shopping Centre. This massive mall truly has everything under one roof-endless shops, eateries, and entertainment options. The layout can feel overwhelming at first, but exploring each section was part of the fun. I loved how clean and well-maintained the place is, with plenty of signage to guide visitors. Whether shopping, dining, or just strolling, there's always something new to discover here. Definitely a five-star experience and worth spending hours in!

places.address: 1, Lebuh Bandar Utama, Bandar Utama, 47800 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: The Curve is a stylish shopping destination located in Petaling Jaya, offering three floors of diverse retail outlets featuring clothing, home goods, and more. In addition to its numerous shops, the mall also boasts a wide array of outdoor dining options and recreational activities. What sets The Curve apart from other malls is its weekly flea market and non-retail events that add an extra layer of excitement to the shopping experience.

sources.snippet: The Curve is Malaysia’s first pedestrianised shopping mall, offering a fantastic mix of food and retail options. Its distinct appeal stems from its distinct ambience, enhanced by its wide canopied walkways and al fresco dining area, divided into Asian and Western Courtyards. The Curve is where your one-stop shopping adventure begins, with modern and sophisticated fashion boutiques, a delectable selection of dining options, trusted beauty and health experts to meet your every need, and a medley of unique stores, lifestyle retailers, and dependable services for you and your entire family.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Best Shopping Malls for Hangouts in Klang Valley 2024

sources.snippet: The Curve has a well-designed Kids Zone on the First Floor which comes with not one but two free play areas for young ones. Kids can climb on a colorful, ship-inspired structure with slides, or explore the indoor playground. Coin-operated rides are also available scattered around on the same floor, along with a baby care room and toy stores like Early Learning Center and Lego.
sources.shortName: Best Malls For Families In Kuala Lumpur

sources.snippet: Owing to its weekly flea market, the Curve Mall is regarded as one of the most popular malls of Petaling Jaya. The weekly flea market houses affordable cult fashion apparels which attract several visitors to the market. This mall houses about 250 stores in addition to several outdoor dining options.
sources.shortName: 14 Things to do in Petaling Jaya Malaysia 2025
20 Malls in Malaysia (2024)

sources.snippet: Located at Mutiara Damansara, The Curve shopping mall is one of the popular shopping malls in KL. It may be located near the Golden Triangle in KL, with plenty of shopping choices, but the Curve Shopping Mall is still worth exploring. With over 250 shops, you will find something that you need.
sources.shortName: 5 Top Shopping Malls In Kl For A Unique Retail Therapy

sources.snippet: This shopping mall is also one of the popular places to visit as it is cleverly located in Mutiara Damansara amongst other big names like Ikea, Ikano Power Center, Cineleisure and Tesco making it a one-stop shoppers heaven.
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls in Petaling Jaya

sources.snippet: The Curve is neither the biggest nor the most popular mall in Kuala Lumpur. It is also located pretty far out of the city center. Still it is a nice place to visit.
sources.shortName: Top10 shopping malls in Kuala Lumpur | FAQ

places.name: The Curve

reviews.text:
The Curve shopping mall in Petaling Jaya, Malaysia, offers a unique and relaxed shopping experience. Unlike the bustling atmosphere of other malls, The Curve is spacious and open, providing a calm environment for shoppers. It features a variety of shops, from fashion to electronics, and a wide range of dining options, including local and international cuisines.

The mall also has a vibrant outdoor area known as “The Street,” where visitors can enjoy live music and outdoor dining. Families will appreciate the kid-friendly arcade and play areas. With its convenient location and ample parking, The Curve is a great destination for a leisurely day out.

Whether you're looking to shop, dine, or simply unwind, The Curve has something for everyone.

The Curve may not be a top-tier mall and isn't particularly crowded even on weekends, but it's very kid-friendly, offering numerous kids' clothing stores and play areas. Most of the restaurants are located in the open-air section on the ground floor, creating a relaxed dining atmosphere.

The Curve is connected by link bridges to Curve NX and IKEA, making it convenient to explore all three locations in one trip.

May 2025
Alamak, so quiet... and cold. but the outside of the building is hot. bid building but less shops, less visitor too, is that because of TRX?

places.address: 6, Jln PJU 7/3, Mutiara Damansara, 47810 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Sunway Pyramid is a massive mall with an Egyptian theme, offering a wide array of retail stores, dining options, and entertainment facilities. The facade of the mall is stunning and it houses numerous attractions such as Sunway Pyramid Ice for ice skating, Galactic Laser for laser tag, Stars Archery, and Sunway Mega Lanes for bowling. Families can also enjoy The Parenthood, an indoor play center for children. Additionally, there are indoor playgrounds and a mini amusement park on the Lower Ground Floor.

sources.snippet: This Egyptian-inspired mall which a stunning façade boasts four million square feet of retail, entertainment and leisure outlets, and is home to a number of attractions including a world class ice skating rink Sunway Pyramid Ice, Galactic Laser for a fun laser tag game, Stars Archery, Sunway Mega Lanes for some bowling, and a large indoor soft play center and children retail area known as The Parenthood. On the Lower Ground Floor, there is also an indoor playground, and a mini amusement park with train rides, bumper cars, merry go round, ferry wheel and more. For parents with toddlers who tend to be little runners, Sunway Pyramid is one of the few malls that offers a child safety device in the form of a Child Distance Monitor and wristband.
sources.shortName: Best Malls For Families In Kuala Lumpur

sources.snippet: Although there are many things to do in Kuala Lumpur, if you're a shopaholic, then keeping a visit to Sunway Pyramid on your to-do list has to be the number one choice. In fact, Sunway Pyramid opened in the year 1997 and became a favorite amongst travelers for its ice rink and various other facilities. In fact, Sunway Pyramid is home to Malaysia's only ice rink and features a number of other facilities like its supermarket, and an array of independent stores to fascinate visitors.
sources.shortName: Top 8 Malls In Kuala Lumpur Every Shopper Should Visit

sources.snippet: Sunway Pyramid, Malaysia’s first Egyptian-themed shopping and entertainment mall, underwent a magnificent transformation in 1997 to become the largest shopping mall in Malaysia. Covering 4.3 million square feet and 7 floors, it offers a retail extravaganza across 4 shopping precincts: Fashion Central, Oasis Boulevard, Asian Avenue, and Marrakesh. The first floor features 100,000 square feet of family-friendly F&B, retail offerings, and a child enrichment and edutainment center.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Popular Largest Shopping Malls in Malaysia

sources.snippet: Sunway Pyramid is Malaysia's first themed lifestyle and adventure shopping mall with 900 retailers across seven floors. The Egyptian-style building flaunts a lion sculpture, Pharaoh statues and domes representing Sun God Ra and the Nile River. Discover an upmarket one-stop destination for fashion, accessories, timepieces, gifts, souvenirs, books, pharmacies, IT kiosks, furnishing and wellness, open daily.
sources.shortName: 20 Malls in Malaysia (2024)

sources.snippet: Sunway Pyramid is one impressively-themed shopping centre which is located in the Klag Valley in Petaling Jaya. This one is the only mall in the country that has an ice skating rink and hence this factor makes it all the more popular among the locals as well as tourists. This one is a distinctively constructed shopping mall which is one of the largest shopping centers within the country.
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls in Petaling Jaya

sources.snippet: Sunway Pyramid is extremely popular among locals that live outside of Kuala Lumpur. It could very well be the most popular mall in Malaysia when looking at absolute amount of monthly visitors. Sunway is more than a shopping mall; it is a huge entertainment complex with numerous bars, restaurants, hundreds of shops, hotels, resorts and even a huge amusement park (and water park).
sources.shortName: Top10 shopping malls in Kuala Lumpur | FAQ

sources.snippet: At the Sunway Pyramid Shopping Mall, a replica of an ancient Egyptian pyramid, you’ll find hundreds of shops selling all items from clothing to electronics to jewellery to toys to souvenirs. Visit the movie theatre, arcade, archery range, or karaoke while doing your holiday shopping. You may satisfy your appetite at any of the mall’s restaurants, cafés, and snack shops.
sources.shortName: 10 PETALING JAYA SHOPPING MALL

sources.snippet: Sunway Pyramid is a unique shopping and entertainment mall in Malaysia that features an Egyptian design. The mall boasts a lion sculpture, Pharaoh statues, and two domes named the Orange and Blue Atrium, representing the Sun God Ra and the Great Nile River, respectively. These elements are an integral part of the building’s structure.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Best Shopping Malls for Hangouts in Klang Valley 2024

sources.snippet: One Utama is noted as the biggest shopping mall in central PJ and with the addition of a new wing, this makes the place one of the top shopping malls to visit in Petaling Jaya. There are a total of 6 floors of shopping with over 5 million square feet of retail and entertainment here.
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls in Petaling Jaya

sources.snippet: The Sunway Pyramid Mall is strategically situated in Selangor which is technically a neighboring State. Yet it is still one of the quintessentially famous shopping malls in Kuala Lumpur. It is known for its famous lion-headed sphinx guarding the entrance.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Shopping Malls in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
10 Best Shopping Malls in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.name: Sunway Pyramid Shopping Mall

reviews.text:
Sunway Pyramid is a high-end shopping mall with a unique and luxurious atmosphere. The design is inspired by ancient Egyptian architecture, complete with grand statues and intricate carvings. The mall is spacious and well-maintained, making it a pleasant place to shop and explore.

One of the standout features is the indoor ambiance-there's a forest-like setting with birds chirping and the soothing sound of flowing water, creating a relaxing shopping experience.

For entertainment, the mall offers an impressive ice skating rink, which is great for both beginners and experienced skaters. There are also plenty of dining options, ranging from popular international brands to local delicacies, ensuring there's something for everyone.

Even small details stand out here-like their uniquely designed washroom signboards, which add to the mall's creative and themed atmosphere.

With a great mix of luxury and mid-range retail stores, Sunway Pyramid is a must-visit destination whether you're shopping, dining, or just looking for a fun day out!

Sunway Pyramid Mall is a great place to shop for quality, branded items at affordable prices. There are many stores to choose from, and you can find a wide variety of products.

It's definitely worth a visit if you're looking for good deals and a nice shopping experience. Highly recommend!

I loved this mall!! Compared to other malls, these stores were pricier, but there was a large variety of shops and restaurants. The ground floor mainly had a lot luxury shops (if that's your style), but personally, I really liked the Asian corner on the top floor. It had smaller clothing shops which sold reasonably priced cute modern tops and dresses.

places.address: Darul Ehsan, Level CP6, Blue Atrium, 3, Jalan PJS 11/15, Bandar Sunway, 47500 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Paradigm Mall is a modern shopping destination located in Petaling Jaya, featuring six floors of well-known stores, various dining options, and a movie theater. The mall also offers amenities such as free shuttle service and ample parking to ensure a pleasant experience for visitors. Additionally, it is conveniently situated near the Kelana Jaya LRT station and the city's busiest expressway. This iconic lifestyle mall provides something for everyone, from shopping and dining to entertainment experiences.

sources.snippet: Paradigm Mall Welcome to Paradigm Mall, the iconic lifestyle mall with something for everyone. Whether you’re a discerning shopper, a window-browser or looking to enjoy new sights, sounds and tastes, you’ll discover a treasure trove of surprises at PJ’s latest shoppertainment centre!. From dining delights to entertainment pleasure down to top fashion highlights and exciting […]
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls in Petaling Jaya Archives

sources.snippet: Paradigm Mall is a one-stop shop for shopping, entertainment, rejuvenation, and fun only a few doors down. All your fundamental necessities are met and the whims and preferences of young urban families at our Petaling Jaya location. We look forward to your welcome to our new landmark mall, where we’ll take your shopping experience to a new level.
sources.shortName: 10 PETALING JAYA SHOPPING MALL

sources.snippet: The Paradigm Mall is a recent suburban mall within the city of Petaling Jaya that comprises of more than 100 fashion store. This mall is not just about a happy shopping experience, but it has a lot of offerings for all the visitors. There is a nine-screen movie theatre, games arcade, gym as well as more than 50 restaurants.
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls in Petaling Jaya

sources.snippet: Fashion: Exclusive brands and fashion stores with great clothing collection are housed in Paradigm Mall. Some of them are H&M, Hush Puppies, Padini Concept Store, Voir, Marks& Spencers, Elle, Max Outlet Store, etc.
sources.shortName: Paradigm Mall, Petaling Jaya (Malaysia) - Shopping, Food, Cinema

places.name: Paradigm Mall

reviews.text:
Visited this Mall with my daughter and her housemate to attend VegFest.My first time visit.It's a lot bigger than expected and only had a brief explore round  before checking out VegFest.
Very well laid out and will definitely require another visit to explore further.Lots of places to eat and drink as well as numerous retail outlets.
I'll be back

A well-balanced mall with a great mix of F&B, retail, and entertainment. Lotus's Hypermarket covers daily needs, GSC Cinema is a nice addition, and ESCAPE Challenge adds fun and excitement. Not too big, not too small-just right for a relaxed shopping experience.

This mall is spacious, clean and I love it here because this shopping mall got everything I needed like places to shopping, restaurants to dine in, various entertainment like cinema, karaoke, something like jungle trekking (idk what's the name) but yes, especially the toilet. The toilet is clean, and got bidet there. I've been here on weekdays since i love less people. So..yeah, this one is better than any other shopping mall.

places.address: 1, Jalan SS 7/26a, SS7, 47301 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Fahrenheit88 is a multilevel shopping destination situated along Bukit Bintang Street, directly across from Pavilion KL. Boasting over 280 stores and services, this mall caters to fashion enthusiasts with its affordable and expansive retail outlets such as Uniqlo, Brands Outlet, and Sephora. With seven floors of indoor and outdoor spaces, visitors can explore a variety of offerings including spa services, karaoke lounges, and casual dining options.

sources.snippet: Fahrenheit88 is a modern mall near opposite of Pavilion KL. It used to be known as KL Plaza, but the new owner wanted to rename the mall after a huge renovation. Fahrenheit88 has some very nice stores. At the top floor you find Signature IT, a huge IT department store.
sources.shortName: Top10 shopping malls in Kuala Lumpur | FAQ

places.name: Fahrenheit88

reviews.text:
Fahrenheit88 is a vibrant shopping destination located in the heart of Bukit Bintang, Kuala Lumpur. Its central location makes it an accessible and convenient spot for both locals and tourists seeking a unique shopping and entertainment experience.

The mall offers a diverse mix of stores, including trendy fashion boutiques, specialty shops, and lifestyle outlets, catering to a variety of tastes and budgets. Whether you're looking for clothing, beauty products, or tech gadgets, there's something here for everyone. It's also home to the popular Uniqlo flagship store, which is a must-visit for quality and affordable apparel.

Fahrenheit88 stands out for its focus on local and independent brands, providing a platform for up-and-coming designers and entrepreneurs. This makes it a great place to find unique and creative products that you won't easily find elsewhere.

The dining options are varied, from casual cafes to international cuisine, perfect for a quick bite or a leisurely meal. The mall also hosts fun events and seasonal decorations, adding to its lively atmosphere.

While it may not be as grand as some neighboring malls like Pavilion KL, Fahrenheit88 offers a more relaxed and intimate shopping experience. If you're in Bukit Bintang, it's definitely worth a visit for its distinct charm and diverse offerings! 🛍️✨

A nice mall with a good mix of stores. Very clean and well laid out. There is an information desk in the middle of the first floor with friendly staff to assist you. On the second floor is a DIY store with a large selection of useful products at great prices. I bought some knee braces for 80% less than the sports store. Upstairs is a cinema.

I've visited this mall several times because it's located in Bukit Bintang, which is a popular and busy area. The mall itself is clean, modern, and generally has a nice environment with friendly staff and a good crowd. However, there are a few things I noticed that I think really need improvement.

First of all, I was surprised to see that there isn't a supermarket or grocery store inside the mall. For a place in such a prime location with so many visitors, it's honestly disappointing. Many people – including tourists, families, and locals – often look for a place to grab essentials or do quick grocery shopping after dining or walking around. Not having that option makes the mall feel incomplete.

Another thing is the baby room. While I appreciate that there is one, it's really small and doesn't have hot or warm water, which is important for families with babies. If you're a parent and need to prepare milk or clean up, it's not very convenient. I really hope they consider upgrading this facility to better support family visitors.

I like this mall and see its potential, but these small things make a big difference. A grocery store and better family-friendly facilities would make the mall much more useful and complete for everyday needs.

places.address: 179, Jln Gading, Bukit Bintang, 55100 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Nestled in the heart of Mid Valley City, The Gardens Mall is a premier shopping destination boasting over 200 outlets across six levels. Visitors can indulge in luxury shopping with renowned brands like Louis Vuitton, Hermes, and Burberry. The mall also offers a diverse culinary experience and features top international cuisines. Additionally, tech enthusiasts and home decor aficionados will find an array of retail outlets catering to their needs.

sources.snippet: The Gardens Mall, located in the heart of Mid Valley City, is a premium 6-level shopping haven with over 200 outlets from a wide range of top international cuisines; or look at the latest technology and home furnishings with several retail outlets waiting to make your gadget or furniture dreams come true. You can also enjoy karaoke sessions with The RedBox with your friends. The Gardens Mall also houses a popular Japanese department store, Isetan, and Malaysia’s most prestigious cinema, Aurum Theatre.
sources.shortName: Top 10 Best Shopping Malls for Hangouts in Klang Valley 2024

sources.snippet: Another top mall to feature in our KL shopping mall list is The Garden. A mall that features more than 200 stores and is spread over six floors, this is a place that features some of the world's best fashion designer brands and labels that are set to make your shopping worthwhile. One interesting thing about this mall is that it is located right next to the Mid Valley Megamall while offers a perfect shopping experience in its vicinity.
sources.shortName: Top 8 Malls In Kuala Lumpur Every Shopper Should Visit

sources.snippet: The Gardens Mall, located in Mid Valley City, a colorful 6-level shopping paradise with over 200 outlets. Malaysia’s largest mall is a fashionista’s dream, featuring top shopping brands like Louis Vuitton, Hermès, Cartier, Tiffany & Co., and Burberry. Indulge your taste buds with diverse international cuisines or explore the latest technology and home furnishings at the many retail outlets.
sources.shortName: 10 Most Popular Largest Shopping Malls in Malaysia

sources.snippet: The Gardens Mall is a premium shopping destination with more than 200 outlets of top fashion brands, latest technology, home & living and edutainment. Heaven for a shopping spree, the 6-level mall stands in the core of the Mid Valley City of Kuala Lumpur. The Gardens Mall in Kuala Lumpur is not just shopping heaven but a perfect spot for entertainment and food too.
sources.shortName: 20 Malls in Malaysia (2024)

places.name: The Gardens Mall

reviews.text: One can spent the entire strolling in this mall which is connected to Mid Valley mall too. It's clean, spacious and a lot of interesting shops to visit. Best to go during Idul Fitri as it offers a lot of discounts.

A mall that has profiled itself as a luxury mall. Here you will find many world-famous brands that stand for high quality and luxury, many of which are from the fashion industry. Worth mentioning are all the spas and beauty clinics on level 4. On the bottom floor, in addition to all the eateries, there is a large grocery store (Jaya Grocer).
A shopping mall that connects between KL Eco mall and Mid Valley shopping mall. Many branded boutiques shop located here. Mall spacious and organised.

places.address: Lingkaran Syed Putra, Mid Valley City, 59200 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Experience the vibrant festivities of Chinese New Year at IPC Shopping Centre in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia, in 2022. Embrace the lively CNY theme that showcases the powerful creatures of the zodiac at IPC's Year of Woohoo event. Regardless of age, there is a plethora of engaging activities and performances for everyone to enjoy. This shopping centre is dedicated to fostering an artistic community and promoting international exchange through interactive discussions, documentation, and exhibitions centered around IPC itself.

sources.snippet: IPC Shopping Centre “To create a better everyday life for the many people.” Keeping true to our Scandinavian heritage, we would like to welcome you to our Family where we bring all your shopping needs and more under one roof. IPC Shopping Centre is anchored by IKEA and integrated with a wide and deep choice […]
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls in Petaling Jaya Archives

places.name: IPC Shopping Centre

reviews.text: IPC Shopping Centre (formerly Ikano Power Centre) is a family-friendly neighborhood mall in Mutiara Damansara, perfect for your daily needs. With a variety of restaurants conveniently located on the lower ground floor, it's also an excellent spot for food lovers.

Lot of eateries & menu to choose from. Most of the shop opens at 10am. Being said so by 10 am you should be on your feet not taking your own sweet time preparing food. Customer waiting time should be less than 10 mins not longer than that
Tried Nasi kukus from Rimba
Generous portion & delicious. Reasonably priced, highly recommended
Other eateries are good too
Pharmacy, Big Supermarket, Family mart for your daily needs & necessities.
Hijab & such booth has varieties, spoilt for choice. Good customer service
QR code payment is accepted here

Hi, i think its time to stop accepting vendor doing this animal show. Clearly the bunnies looked terrified hiding under the stools and imagine the long weekend, weekday hours in a mall. This is clearly unfair for the animals, be it rabbits and cats. Stop supporting this act.

places.address: 2, Jalan PJU 7/2, Mutiara Damansara, 47800 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: NU Sentral Shopping Mall is a bustling multi-level shopping complex located in the heart of Kuala Lumpur. It serves as a central transportation hub, with several metro lines and the monorail connecting to the new KL Sentral railway station. The mall is surrounded by high rises and offers convenient access to various modes of transportation. Visitors can explore its diverse range of shops, restaurants, and entertainment options.

sources.snippet: Located next to KL Sentral, the transportation hub of KL, this strategic location makes it easy for those who travel by public transport. You can have a quick shop if you still have some time waiting for the next train. It may not have as much choice as the other larger malls in the city, but it still has a well-curated selection of stores for you to shop.
sources.shortName: 5 Top Shopping Malls In Kl For A Unique Retail Therapy

sources.snippet: The eight storied Nu Sentral shopping mall is linked with the KL Sentral which is the central hub of the vast railway network in Kuala Lumpur. The huge array of stores houses several mid-range outlets retailing top western and Asian brands galore. There are ample opportunities for entertainment, dining and shopping alike.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Shopping Malls in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
10 Best Shopping Malls in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.name: NU Sentral

reviews.text: Always happy to visit this mall, because of the convenience of KL Sentral. The mall is huge and serves all walks of life, especially travellers. Great shopping and food choices, too. Recommended.

The mall is in a very convenient location near KL Sentral station. The shops here are rather limited in choice but there are a wide variety of restaurants for dining. A very nice spot for travellers to spend some time.

The first mall that i go through when I arrived in KL sentral. went here to buy Touch and Go Card.

Nice foodcourt where I have my late lunch as Im hungry after the flight. Just go here if you're waiting for your travel starting from KL Sentral

places.address: 201, Jalan Tun Sambanthan, Kuala Lumpur Sentral, 50470 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: LaLaport Bukit Bintang City Centre is the first of its kind in Southeast Asia, offering six floors of shopping space with a mix of local and international brands, including some exclusive Japanese labels not found elsewhere in Malaysia. This new addition to Kuala Lumpur's shopping scene opened its doors in January 2022 and features a unique white gateway that stands as a remnant of the historic Pudu Prison upon which the mall is built.

sources.snippet: One of the latest shopping malls in KL, LaLaport is a must-visit place. Owned by the Mitsui Fudosan Group, this shopping mall has many Japanese stalls and restaurants you won’t see at other shopping malls in KL. The first thing that attracts you will be the staircase Grand Steps.
sources.shortName: 5 Top Shopping Malls In Kl For A Unique Retail Therapy

places.name: LaLaport Bukit Bintang City Centre

reviews.text: Visiting LalaPort Mall was an enjoyable and convenient experience. The mall has a modern and spacious layout that makes it easy to navigate, even on a busy day. One of the first things I appreciated was the variety of shops. Ranging from international brands to local favorites, which gave me plenty of options for both shopping and browsing. The food court was another highlight, offering a mix of Japanese, Asian, and Western cuisine. It was clean, well-organized, and had enough seating even during peak hours. I especially liked the presence of some niche eateries that are hard to find in other malls. What stood out to me the most was the attention to design and atmosphere. The interiors were aesthetically pleasing and there was a calm, relaxed vibe throughout. It didn't feel overly commercial or rushed, which made the experience more pleasant. I also noticed that the facilities were well-maintained. Restrooms were clean and there were plenty of places to rest or wait comfortably.

A huge and sophisticated mall with many big brands and upcoming ones especially from Japan. I went on a weekday and the mall seems too quiet with not much crowd. Perhaps as stores are only about only 65% open. I will visit again soon when it's fully open. Looking forward to the Japanese brands.

Why are all the free indoor playgrounds/play areas being removed one by one?

There used to be a play area on Level 1 and Level 2, and two play areas at Level 4 inside the food court. But now, only the one on Level 1 remains-and it's not very big either. It gets extremely crowded on weekends.

Please consider bringing back more free play areas. They really encourage families with children, like mine, to shop and dine at your mall. In fact, the free play areas were the main reason we decided to visit in the first place.

places.address: 2, Jln Hang Tuah, Bukit Bintang, 55100 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Plaza Low Yat, located in Kuala Lumpur, is one of the city's oldest shopping centers and is known for its focus on electronic items such as mobile phones, cameras, and accessories. While it offers a wide range of options for tech enthusiasts, visitors should be cautious as some shops may sell duplicated gadgets.

sources.snippet: Plaza Low Yat or Low Yat as named by the locals, is another shopping mall with a difference. You will not discover the usual apparel and clothing boutique stores here or novelty stationery outlets. Plaza Low Yat is one of the reputed Kuala Lumpur malls where buyers seek bargain offers and deals for IT and electronics items.
sources.shortName: 10 Best Shopping Malls in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
10 Best Shopping Malls in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

sources.snippet: Not all tourists will like Lowyat as it is small, crowded and often very noisy. Lowyat is the premier IT, Gadget and Lifestyle mall in Kuala Lumpur. Here you will find hundreds of small shops selling luxurious products like cameras, phones, laptops, tablets and much more.
sources.shortName: Top10 shopping malls in Kuala Lumpur | FAQ

places.name: Plaza Low Yat

reviews.text: Great place for phones and computers. A large mall filled with phone and computer stores and repair shops. You can find anything here. I picked up a nice laptop at a great price.

Wow! As a tech person, this was an excellent experience for me. A mall filled with computers and gadgets. I could literally spend a day here,  which I did 😆🤓
I even bought my Samsung S25 Ultra here at a good price. USD1250. The mall has everything you can wish for when it comes to mobile phones, laptops and computers and electronics. We'll worth a visit 👍🤓🤓

You can easily spend more than two hours in this mall without getting board. Everything related to electronics is found in Plaza Low Yat from PC spare parts to cellphones, electronics accessories ,drones and much more. A must visit place in KL

places.address: 7, Jalan Bintang off Jalan Bukit Bintang LYBB, Bukit Bintang, 55100 Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Lot 10 is a vibrant 5-story shopping mall located in the heart of Kuala Lumpur's main shopping and entertainment district. Recently renovated, it now features ISETAN, The Japan Store, offering an authentic Japanese experience with a wide range of goods imported from Japan. Visitors can explore local boutiques, concept stores, and international brands while enjoying the diverse dining options at Lot 10 Hutong Foodcourt.

sources.snippet: Lot10 is perhaps the most centrally located mall in Kuala Lumpur, right along Jalan Bukit Bintang. It has quite a few nice shops and also a National Geographer Flagship Store. In the basement you can find Hutong, a wonderful food court with mainly Chinese hawkers.
sources.shortName: Top10 shopping malls in Kuala Lumpur | FAQ

places.name: Lot 10

reviews.text: I really like how they have renovated this place and give it a nice modern look. Many shops are Japanese theme and also large selection of Japanese food is available. The H&M is huge and Swee Lee music store is well stocked. The food court on the top floor has a very relaxing vibe

Shopping centre with a food court, restaurants and a quite variety of shops. HM, Don Donkey, Beryl's, Pierre Cardin lingerie, musical instruments and much more.
There is sone really nice restaurants that aren't to expensive.
There is also a Gaming Hall.
And the Food Court is pretty good

My wife and I were here today for a look-see. We last visited this shopping mall in 2017 - we are from Johor Bahru. Sadly, in our opinion, this shopping mall has aged a lot since, and the shops therein looked "tired and weary" - except maybe the Don Don Donki outlet and the H&M outlet. We were also quite disappointed that there is a 50 Sen charge for using the public toilets here. For us, the only place worth visiting here is Hutong 10 - our favourite food court in KL.

places.address: 50, Bukit Bintang Rd, Bukit Bintang, 55100 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: The Starling is a modern and spacious mall featuring a variety of specialty shops, a movie theater, food court, and even a rooftop garden. One of its highlights is Dreamworld Playland, an indoor playground with a snow-themed design that offers kids an exciting play structure including slides, tunnels, and climbing walls. Additionally, the mall houses Nicsmann 1940s By Lewre restaurant which offers great value for money dining options.

sources.snippet: This is a place where you may reconnect with your inner self, others, and Mother Nature. When you’re around your loved ones, you’ll burst with joy. You are the centre of the world in this retail mall where you can do everything.
sources.shortName: 10 PETALING JAYA SHOPPING MALL

places.name: the Starling

reviews.text: Bustling, clean, airy mall with lots if shops. Food court on 3rd level is a great place for a quick meal or for friends to catch up. There are many shops of different types from telcos, clothes,  bars, bottle shops, supermarkets, massage, and many more. Restaurants range from food court, fast food, mid range to high end ones.

The mall is spacious and thoughtfully designed, featuring a wide variety of shops and F&B outlets that cater to different tastes and preferences. It's a great spot for shopping, dining, or just hanging out. However, the parking system feels outdated, still relying on paper tickets and cash-only machines, which can be inconvenient. A modern upgrade would really enhance the overall experience.

Visited this huge mall by today 8/3/2025. The mall is located just in the heart of PJ also known as Damansara uptown. It is surrounded by lots of shoplets and eateries. It is very hard to find street paid parking. Therefore, the cheapest and most convenient option is to park inside the starling mall. However, it is a bit tricky to find the entrance into the mall parking. You have to circle the building a bit and try to search for the word uptown7. I drove very slowly and went up the ram into the mall parking on the first floor. If you opt to park at the premier parking lot then you have to fork out extra money which from my inspection is RM4 for the first hour. This is because you only have to walk a bit to the mall entrance compared to the normal parking lots that need to walk a wee bit from the mall entrance but it is way cheaper. For the weekend and public holiday  normal parking lot rate is the first two hours is RM1 and then third and fourth hour is RM1 per hour and subsequently hour is RM2 per hour. The mall is more like specializing in eateries. The mall is the heaven for food hunters. Lots of nice restaurants and even their food court is full of diners and delicious foods!!! Definitely worth to pay a visit to the mall. The mall also has an event hall at level 5 that constantly has warehouse sales. For this weekend, there are Rohto Mentholatum sales. Most of the items were up to 80% discounted and the expiry date is about 1.5 years later. Therefore, it is still consider a good deal if you have a fans of skincare. Would definitely will visit this mall again in future. The only problem is the traffic outside the mall is horrendous.

places.address: 6, Jalan SS 21/37, Damansara Utama, 47400 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Sungei Wang Plaza, also known as the 'River of Gold', has been a prominent shopping destination in Bukit Bintang since 1977. With over 800 retail shops and restaurants, it continues to attract crowds of visitors. The mall houses more than 500 retail outlets offering a wide range of products, including fashion for youth from various home-grown labels on the top floor.

sources.snippet: Older shopping malls sometimes lose out on crowds over a period of time although Sungei Wang Plaza is an exception. This is a classic Kuala Lumpur shopping mall, spanning 7 storeys and is a fantastic place for top-notch bargains. Sungei Wang Plaza (image courtesy: capitaland.com)
sources.shortName: 10 Best Shopping Malls in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia
10 Best Shopping Malls in Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

sources.snippet: For some affordable and exclusive shopping therapy, you can visit the Sungei Wang Plaza, one of the best featured places on the KL shopping mall list. Opened in the year 1979, the plaza is built on an area of 1.2 million sq. ft with the best retail outlets.
sources.shortName: Top 8 Malls In Kuala Lumpur Every Shopper Should Visit

places.name: Sungei Wang Plaza

reviews.text: Sungei Wang Plaza was the first mall I visited in Kuala Lumpur. It's located in a very busy area of the city and has a bit of everything:mainly small shops, local restaurants, and a supermarket with plenty of Malaysian food items, great for souvenirs. Worth a visit.

A simple mall made up of majority clothing/fashion stores, restaurants, a decent sized food court on the top floor, and more. It's not in my opinion a super exciting/interesting mall as it's on the simpler side yet if you're looking to buy clothing, shoes, accessories, etc, you'll probably really like this mall.

Plaza Sungei Wang is more of a market-style shopping centre rather than a high-end mall. Lots of small shops, budget fashion, tech accessories, and a big focus on gaming culture. We noticed what looked like a gaming tournament or e-sports event happening while we were there, which might be exciting if you're into that scene.

That said, it wasn't really our style of shopping – quite busy, a bit older in feel, and more geared toward niche hobbies or bargain hunting than mainstream retail.

✅ Worth checking out if you're into gaming, cosplay, or retro gadgets – otherwise, there are more modern malls nearby like Pavilion or Lot 10.

📍Good central location in Bukit Bintang, with easy access from the monorail.

places.address: Jln Sultan Ismail, Bukit Bintang, 55100 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Bangsar Shopping Centre is a modern indoor mall that houses a variety of international brands for shopping and dining. Recently, the mall had to temporarily close due to a staff member testing positive for Covid-19. However, the affected staff had not shown any symptoms while on duty and had not been in the mall since. The entire staff is undergoing Covid-19 testing as per health guidelines, and the mall will undergo intensive sanitization before reopening on 12 October 2020.

sources.snippet: Bangsar Shopping Centre, also known as BSC Centre, is a high-tech lifestyle mall that is known for international brands, high-end boutiques of local designers, and its themed décors. The mall has 6 storeys that sprawl across an area of about 322,000 sqft. Several premium luxury stores and fine dining restaurants are housed here.
sources.shortName: 20 Malls in Malaysia (2024)

places.name: Bangsar Shopping Centre

reviews.text: Bangsar Shopping Centre is a fantastic place to shop, dine, and relax! The atmosphere is sophisticated and welcoming, with a great selection of stores catering to all needs. The dining options are excellent, offering a variety of cuisines to suit every palate. The cleanliness and organization of the mall are top-notch, making it a pleasant experience to visit. The staff in the shops are friendly and helpful, adding to the overall great vibe. Highly recommended for anyone looking for a classy yet comfortable shopping experience.

Been quite awhile since my last visit to BSC...even the roads leading here (from Damansara) is not the same. You might end up in KL instead if you're not guided by Waze / Grab car / signage🥴

This is definitely a shopping 'stop' for the rich / T20 class. Unlike the regular malls around PJ & KL, you won't find the usual shopping atmosphere nor brands as the tenants within are very exclusive and tailored for the high net worth shoppers. From grocery to F&B, jewelry and even clothing, each outlet is exquisitely designed and housed in a personalized space where only the average shopper can feast their eyes or perhaps window shop merely for leisure. Every floor is unique and not the same, somewhat like traveling in a maze with shops positioned in unimaginable corners / space.🧐 Do refer to my photos attached for illustration.

Well BSC has upscaled so much over time that you might just consider coming here every now and then or ocassionaly under invitation for a formal event.😂
There's much to be said about BSC, but the cream of it all is its beautiful thoughtful, generous prayer room. I would just like to say thank you and well done.

places.address: 285, Jalan Maarof, Bangsar, 59000 Kuala Lumpur, Federal Territory of Kuala Lumpur, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Subang Parade is a renowned shopping complex with over 200 shops, eateries, cafes, and a cinema. It's considered a pride of the Subang Jaya and USJ districts in Malaysia. With more than 160 retail shops offering various goods and services, it attracts both locals and tourists. Despite not being as large as other malls, it features quality restaurants and tech stores. The mall also houses a GSC Theatre but is relatively smaller.

sources.snippet: Subang Parade is one of the longest shopping malls located within the country and it is also considered to be a pride of the Subang Jaya and USJ districts in Malaysia. There are more than 160 retail shops located here that together offer all kinds of goods and services – from fancy apparels to some of the most high-end restaurants. This place is not just popular among the locals, but is also famous among all the tourists and visitors from different states and countries.
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls in Petaling Jaya
Shopping Malls in Petaling Jaya

places.name: Subang Parade

reviews.text: This mall was probably every family's go-to mall back in the 80s. Was transported back into my childhood stepping into this mall after so long. There used the be a Grandy's where we occasionally have family dinners. The place hasn't changed much. It still has those connecting slope bridges between the 2 sides of the mall. Checked out the cny clothes at Parkson. Quite impressed that it's pretty well-stocked with many pretty clothes. There's a Flyproject studio where you can come for pilates. A Village Grocer to do your grocery shopping. Toilet was clean.

Visited this mall on 18.12.24, after many years. Used to come here often during my younger days. Back then this was THE go-to place for many folks living in the Klang Valley area. Sad to see it like this now. Many shops have closed down. Half-dead, holding on to dear life because of the supermarket (Village Grocer), the cinema (GSC), Parkson and the numerous restaurants. Toilets were dirty af. Valet parking was RM12 - No choice because normal outdoor parking always full & basement parking bloody dark + cannot fit large pickup truck.

The parent's room at subang parade is child friendly and accommodating to parents as well. However, there are some exceptions that make the experience a bit daunting.

Issues with the parents room include:

1. The changing mat: I don't get why they use changing mats that can't be cleaned effectively which leaves previous baby poop and other stains all over them. There have been ants all over the changing station as a result of poor cleaning frequency. Also? I don't know how frequently this is cleaned through out the day. It's better to just lift the whole mat off and use your own but this is a problem if you didn't come equipped with a changing mat.

2. The breastfeeding room doors- for the longest time this one door has not been repaired. I don't understand why it's so difficult to just fix the door and the locking mechanism.

3. Temperature- when you go in the breastfeeding room and you are trying to nurse a very hungry baby, your body starts to sweat when you are seated like that for up to 40mins. Baby is also turning red from heat and constantly close against mommy. The air conditioner never works. Bring your own portable fan, since they clearly have no interest to fix this issue.

4. Shoes- are all patrons of parents room supposed to take off shoes or only for the play area? They used to have a list of rules on the wall prior to renovations ( when it was a “mothers” only room). Now there's no clear indication of the rule regarding shoes.

Perks to the parents room:

1. Hot and cold water dispenser

2. Clean toilet for parent and child

3. Play area for older children with various toys

4. Bright lighting and nice interior designs

places.address: Lot A, Basement 5, Jalan SS16/1, Ss 16, 47500 Subang Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Tropicana Gardens Mall is a mid-sized neighborhood mall located in the upscale Tropicana district, easily accessible from Persiaran Surian and Persiaran Tropicana. It offers a unique lifestyle, dining, entertainment, and leisure experience for middle to upper-class customers. The mall is conveniently situated next to the Surian MRT station. For wellness enthusiasts, Curvena at Tropicana Gardens Mall provides massage services with a focus on enhanced wellness.

sources.snippet: Persiaran Surian and Persiaran Tropicana provide easy access to this Tropicana Indah shopping centre, which is tucked away in the upscale Tropicana district. The Surian MRT station is located right next door to the mall. Tropicana Gardens Mall provides a unique lifestyle, dining, entertainment, and leisure experience for the middle-upper customer profile as a mid-sized neighbourhood mall.
sources.shortName: 10 PETALING JAYA SHOPPING MALL

sources.snippet: Another new mall in the Damansara area, Tropicana City Shopping Mall is one of the popular places for the people living in Petaling Jaya that opened at the end of 2008.
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls in Petaling Jaya

places.name: IOI Mall Damansara

reviews.text:
Tropicana Gardens Mall is a decent mid-sized shopping center with a comfortable and less hectic atmosphere. During my visit on a Monday afternoon, the mall was relatively quiet, which made for a pleasant and relaxed experience. Parking was hassle-free, and I was pleasantly surprised to find that the first three hours were free-a definite plus.

The mall features a good selection of F&B outlets, especially on the ground floor, while the other floors house a mix of retail stores with a familiar setup. While exploring, I noticed several stores offering clearance sales, with some moving out. Despite discounts of up to 80%, I found the prices still not quite justifiable, particularly for their dresses. Additionally, there were quite a few vacant shop lots, though the overall mall environment managed to conceal this well.

I had lunch at Roberto's, which was a nice experience, and overall, I enjoyed my visit. While the mall is still developing, I see potential for it to thrive in the near future, especially if more businesses set up shop. It's a promising place for those who prefer a quieter shopping experience without overwhelming crowds.

I purposely came here for a GSC movie that so happen have more screening time at this mall. Overall there are many F&B options at ground floor and more shops at Central CC. West Walk is more quiet and less shop occupancy. Seriously I feel mall less attractive but is OK.

IOI Mall Damansara, previously Tropicana Gardens Mall, is a clean and modern shopping destination with good potential. It offers a decent selection of retail stores, dining options, and a supermarket, plus the convenience of an MRT station connection. However, there are still many empty shop lots, which limits the overall variety and buzz of the mall. It's spacious and easy to navigate, making it pleasant for a casual visit. With more stores, it could be even better. Four stars!

places.address: 2A, Persiaran Surian, Tropicana Indah, Kota Damansara, 47810 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Empire Shopping Gallery, also known as ESG, is a stylish and vibrant shopping destination located in Subang Jaya. With over 180 stores, the mall offers a wide range of global brands, beauty and health services, and international eateries. Despite its size, it includes shops for daily essentials like kitchen utilities, bedding products, skincare items, and more.

sources.snippet: Empire Gallery is the latest addition to shopping malls in Petaling Jaya and is located in Subang Jaya, a township in between Klang and Kuala Lumpur.
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls in Petaling Jaya

places.name: NU EMPIRE

reviews.text:
Had a pleasant experience at NU Empire Shopping Gallery! The mall is clean, comfortable, and has a good variety of food options. We bought some sushi to go, then dined in at Bungkus Kaw Kaw - the bihun was really flavorful!

While enjoying the bihun, I could taste the lemongrass, which reminded me of the lemongrass paste I bought in Japan. That sparked an idea - I'll definitely try recreating the dish at home!

Before heading back to JB, we also picked up some fresh-cut fruits for the road. Overall, a convenient and satisfying stop. Will return again! InsyaAllah

This small shopping mall has potential, but poor management is holding it back. The lower ground floor is bustling with restaurants, but the upper floors feel like a ghost town with hardly any visitors. To make matters worse, the escalator has been under repair for months with no progress in sight. Definitely needs better upkeep and management.

Very first time came here was year 2018 if not mistaken. Attended road show. Today came here for met client at soho office. Lift damn slow. Only 2 lifts sometime skip ur level.. after appointment walked around here not much people maybe all went to LG restaurant or grocery stores.

places.address: Jalan SS 16/1, Ss 16, 47500 Subang Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: CITTA Mall is an open-air strip mall located in Petaling Jaya, Malaysia. It offers a spacious and community-centric shopping experience with a variety of brand-name retail stores, restaurants, and a cinema. The mall emphasizes space and integration with the surrounding community. Visitors can explore numerous food and beverage options, vibrant fashion choices, and entertainment activities. CITTA Mall hosts events and has a lively atmosphere, especially during festive seasons.

sources.snippet: Located in Petaling Jaya, Malaysia’s exotic Citta Mall has an open-air configuration, with emphasis on space and catering. This mall provides you with tons of food and beverage options, vivid fashion choices, and entertainment options to explore.
sources.shortName: 14 Things to do in Petaling Jaya Malaysia 2025

sources.snippet: Citta Mall The word CITTA came from an ancient language, and refers to your mind and heart. Staying true to its namesake, CITTA Mall aspires to be a place where the mind and heart meet as one. A place that presents life at its fullest.
sources.shortName: Shopping Malls in Petaling Jaya Archives

sources.snippet: In addition to retail shops, restaurants, and a movie theatre, CITTA Mall has a variety of activities and events. 1 Jalan PJU 1a/48, Ara Damansara, Selangor is the location. The phone number is 03-7662 5000.
sources.shortName: 10 PETALING JAYA SHOPPING MALL

places.name: CITTA Mall

reviews.text:
CITTA Mall is a great place for relaxed shopping and dining. It's not overly crowded like some big malls, which makes it more comfortable to walk around. There's a good mix of local and international restaurants, plus essential stores and services like groceries, salons, and a cinema.

The open-air layout gives it a unique and breezy feel, and there's plenty of parking available. The mall also regularly hosts fun events and weekend activities, which is great for families.

If you're looking for a casual, stress-free mall experience with good food and convenience, CITTA Mall is definitely worth a visit!

It is one of a kind open air multi storey mall in the Klang Valley, pretty different concept compared to other malls around. Though the environment can feel warm and stuffy, and when it rains, it was very wet especially coming from the parking.
Located near Ara Damansara.
More of a strip mall concept like the malls in the United States.....got many places to eat and also recently hosted a walk event to raise awareness on autism.....

places.address: 1, Jalan PJU 1a/48, Pusat Perdagangan Dana 1, 47301 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: WINDLAB Indoor Skydiving offers a thrilling experience for both beginners and experienced skydivers in a safe and controlled environment. Located at One Utama Shopping Centre, this indoor skydiving facility provides the opportunity to feel weightlessness and simulate free-fall in their Vertical Wind Tunnel. With friendly instructors on hand to provide pre-flight training, even those with no prior skills or experience can enjoy the exhilaration of skydiving.

sources.snippet: For those who want more thrills, AirRider Indoor Skydiving will definitely excite you!. One of the largest in Asia with experienced instructors, AirRider will be a popular place to try out indoor skydiving. Besides flying, you can also enjoy the waves and get wet with FlowRider – a growing sport that brings a whole new playground and atmosphere of wave surfing!.
sources.shortName: Discover 1 Utama Shopping Centre

places.name: WINDLAB Indoor Skydiving

reviews.text:
The instructor was extremely professional, making the entire experience feel safe and enjoyable. I had complete peace of mind throughout the flight, and even my 7-year-old child could participate with full confidence.

Before the flight, there was a detailed briefing where the instructor explained hand signals to communicate different movements, as the wind can be too strong to hear instructions clearly.

There are different flight options available, including standard low-altitude flying and high-altitude flying with the instructor. You can check with the counter to see which package best suits you. The staff were very friendly and never pressured us into choosing the more expensive options.

However, please note that this activity may not be suitable for individuals with heart conditions. Personally, I felt a little dizzy after spinning multiple times, so it's something to keep in mind.

Overall, I was extremely satisfied with the instructor's guidance. The entire experience was well-organized, and professional cameras captured every moment. If you like the footage, you can purchase it afterward. Highly recommended!

Tried last weekend and it was absolutely awesome! The instructor (didn't catch his name-tall and skinny fit guy) was super cool. He explained everything clearly, step by step, and made sure we felt safe and confident throughout. He handled everything with great care inside the tunnel and did an amazing job, especially with his stunts at the end of the session. Can't wait to go back and do it all over again!

Windlab offers an amazing experience and outstanding customer service. During our visit, there was an unexpected power outage beyond their control, yet the staff handled it exceptionally well and compensated us generously. Their professionalism and care made a big difference, and we truly appreciated the way they managed the situation. A fantastic and memorable activity - highly recommended.

places.address: S601, 1, Utama E, 2nd floor, 1 Utama Shopping Centre, 1, Lebuh Bandar Utama, Bandar Utama, 47800 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia

places.generalDescription: Camp5 Climbing Gym, located in a shopping mall, offers an exhilarating climbing experience with city views and bouldering opportunities. The facility provides rock climbing walls suitable for all skill levels, making it an ideal venue for teams to push their limits and support each other. With certified instructors ensuring safety, both children and adults can enjoy the various climbing zones available. It's a perfect place for families and friends seeking indoor adventure in Kuala Lumpur, offering thrilling experiences through climbing and bouldering packages.

sources.snippet: Check out the 36-lane bowling alley called U-Bowl or try out Asia’s largest indoor rock climbing centre – Camp5. Besides that, there are also five futsal courts on the upper roof of the mall for sports enthusiasts. For those who want more thrills, AirRider Indoor Skydiving will definitely excite you!.
sources.shortName: Discover 1 Utama Shopping Centre

places.name: Camp5 Climbing Gym

reviews.text:
Have been visiting here since years ago with friends and finally joined the Basic Wall Course. Instructor was very good in explaining the basics and skills for wall climbing. The course was very informative and fun!

Climbing areas, there are beginner friendly routes too, so anyone can try climbing. Clean amenities and good coffee.

This gym is close by to level 5 rainforest car park lots . Friendly, helpful and attentive staff. This outlet is great for top rope with many walls to try on . There is shower facilities and a simple cafe for break time.

The instructors are good and patient. The café food is delicious. I just wish they sold isotonic drinks too 🫣

Many people have trouble finding Camp 5. I hope the OU management will consider adding clearer directions.

places.address: 5th Floor, Camp Five Sdn Bhd (684938-T EZ501, 1 Utama Shopping Centre (New Wing), 1, Lebuh Bandar Utama, Bandar Utama, 47800 Petaling Jaya, Selangor, Malaysia
